trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to use the MediaProcessingTrigger and a background task to process media files in the background.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to use the MediaProcessingTrigger and a background task to process media files in the background.

trans-unit.source: Process media files in the background
trans-unit.target: Process media files in the background

trans-unit.source: Process media files in the background
trans-unit.target: Process media files in the background

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to use the [**MediaProcessingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806005) and a background task to process media files in the background.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to use the [**MediaProcessingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806005) and a background task to process media files in the background.

trans-unit.source: The example app described in this article allows the user to select an input media file to transcode and specify an output file for the transcoding result.
trans-unit.target: The example app described in this article allows the user to select an input media file to transcode and specify an output file for the transcoding result.

trans-unit.source: Then, a background task is launched to perform the transcoding operation.
trans-unit.target: Then, a background task is launched to perform the transcoding operation.

trans-unit.source: The [**MediaProcessingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806005) is intended to support many different media processing scenarios besides transcoding, including rendering media compositions to disk and uploading processed media files after processing is complete.
trans-unit.target: The [**MediaProcessingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806005) is intended to support many different media processing scenarios besides transcoding, including rendering media compositions to disk and uploading processed media files after processing is complete.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information on the different Universal Windows app features utilized in this sample, see:
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information on the different Universal Windows app features utilized in this sample, see:

trans-unit.source: Transcode media files
trans-unit.target: Transcode media files

trans-unit.source: Launching resuming and background tasks
trans-unit.target: Launching resuming and background tasks

trans-unit.source: Tiles badges and notifications
trans-unit.target: Tiles badges and notifications

trans-unit.source: Create a media processing background task
trans-unit.target: Create a media processing background task

trans-unit.source: To add a background task to your existing solution in Microsoft Visual Studio, Enter a name for your comp
trans-unit.target: To add a background task to your existing solution in Microsoft Visual Studio, Enter a name for your comp

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, select **Add** and then **New Project...**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, select **Add** and then **New Project...**.

trans-unit.source: Select the project type **Windows Runtime Component (Universal Windows)**.
trans-unit.target: Select the project type **Windows Runtime Component (Universal Windows)**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for your new component project.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for your new component project.

trans-unit.source: This example uses the project name **MediaProcessingBackgroundTask**.
trans-unit.target: This example uses the project name **MediaProcessingBackgroundTask**.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the icon for the "Class1.cs" file that is created by default and select **Rename**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the icon for the "Class1.cs" file that is created by default and select **Rename**.

trans-unit.source: Rename the file to "MediaProcessingTask.cs".
trans-unit.target: Rename the file to "MediaProcessingTask.cs".

trans-unit.source: When Visual Studio asks if you want to rename all of the references to this class, click **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: When Visual Studio asks if you want to rename all of the references to this class, click **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: In the renamed class file, add the following **using** directives to include these namespaces in your project.
trans-unit.target: In the renamed class file, add the following **using** directives to include these namespaces in your project.

trans-unit.source: BackgroundUsing
trans-unit.target: BackgroundUsing

trans-unit.source: Update your class declaration to make your class inherit from [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794).
trans-unit.target: Update your class declaration to make your class inherit from [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794).

trans-unit.source: BackgroundClass
trans-unit.target: BackgroundClass

trans-unit.source: Add the following member variables to your class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following member variables to your class:

trans-unit.source: An [**IBackgroundTaskInstance**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224797) that will be used to update the foreground app with the progress of the background task.
trans-unit.target: An [**IBackgroundTaskInstance**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224797) that will be used to update the foreground app with the progress of the background task.

trans-unit.source: A [**BackgroundTaskDeferral**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700499) that keeps the system from shutting down your background task while media transcoding is being performed asynchronously.
trans-unit.target: A [**BackgroundTaskDeferral**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700499) that keeps the system from shutting down your background task while media transcoding is being performed asynchronously.

trans-unit.source: A **CancellationTokenSource** object that can be used to cancel the asynchronous transcoding operation.
trans-unit.target: A **CancellationTokenSource** object that can be used to cancel the asynchronous transcoding operation.

trans-unit.source: The [**MediaTranscoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207080) object that will be used to transcode media files.
trans-unit.target: The [**MediaTranscoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207080) object that will be used to transcode media files.

trans-unit.source: BackgroundMembers
trans-unit.target: BackgroundMembers

trans-unit.source: The system calls [**Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method of a background task when the task is launched.
trans-unit.target: The system calls [**Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method of a background task when the task is launched.

trans-unit.source: Set the [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794) object passed into the method to the corresponding member variable.
trans-unit.target: Set the [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794) object passed into the method to the corresponding member variable.

trans-unit.source: Register a handler for the [**Canceled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224798) event, which will be raised if the system needs to shut down the background task.
trans-unit.target: Register a handler for the [**Canceled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224798) event, which will be raised if the system needs to shut down the background task.

trans-unit.source: Then, set the [**Progress**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224800) property to zero.
trans-unit.target: Then, set the [**Progress**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224800) property to zero.

trans-unit.source: Next, call the background task object's [**GetDeferral**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700507) method to obtain a deferral.
trans-unit.target: Next, call the background task object's [**GetDeferral**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700507) method to obtain a deferral.

trans-unit.source: This tells the system not to shut down your task because you are performing asynchronous operations.
trans-unit.target: This tells the system not to shut down your task because you are performing asynchronous operations.

trans-unit.source: Next, call the helper method **TranscodeFileAsync**, which is defined in the next section.
trans-unit.target: Next, call the helper method **TranscodeFileAsync**, which is defined in the next section.

trans-unit.source: If that completes successfully, a helper method is called to launch a toast notification to alert the user that transcoding is complete.
trans-unit.target: If that completes successfully, a helper method is called to launch a toast notification to alert the user that transcoding is complete.

trans-unit.source: At the end of the **Run** method, call [**Complete**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700504) on the deferral object to let the system know that your background task is complete and can be terminated.
trans-unit.target: At the end of the **Run** method, call [**Complete**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700504) on the deferral object to let the system know that your background task is complete and can be terminated.

trans-unit.source: Run
trans-unit.target: Run

trans-unit.source: In the **TranscodeFileAsync** helper method, the file names for the input and output files for the transcoding operations are retrieved from the [**LocalSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241622) for your app.
trans-unit.target: In the **TranscodeFileAsync** helper method, the file names for the input and output files for the transcoding operations are retrieved from the [**LocalSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241622) for your app.

trans-unit.source: These values will be set by your foreground app.
trans-unit.target: These values will be set by your foreground app.

trans-unit.source: Create a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object for the input and output files and then create an encoding profile to use for transcoding.
trans-unit.target: Create a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object for the input and output files and then create an encoding profile to use for transcoding.

trans-unit.source: Call [**PrepareFileTranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700936), passing in the input file, output file, and encoding profile.
trans-unit.target: Call [**PrepareFileTranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700936), passing in the input file, output file, and encoding profile.

trans-unit.source: The [**PrepareTranscodeResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700941) object returned from this call lets you know if transcoding can be performed.
trans-unit.target: The [**PrepareTranscodeResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700941) object returned from this call lets you know if transcoding can be performed.

trans-unit.source: If the [**CanTranscode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700942) property is true, call [**TranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700946) to perform the transcoding operation.
trans-unit.target: If the [**CanTranscode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700942) property is true, call [**TranscodeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700946) to perform the transcoding operation.

trans-unit.source: The **AsTask** method enables you to track the progress the asynchronous operation or cancel it.
trans-unit.target: The **AsTask** method enables you to track the progress the asynchronous operation or cancel it.

trans-unit.source: Create a new **Progress** object, specifying the units of progress you desire and the name of the method that will be called to notify you of the current progress of the task.
trans-unit.target: Create a new **Progress** object, specifying the units of progress you desire and the name of the method that will be called to notify you of the current progress of the task.

trans-unit.source: Pass the **Progress** object into the **AsTask** method along with the cancellation token that allows you to cancel the task.
trans-unit.target: Pass the **Progress** object into the **AsTask** method along with the cancellation token that allows you to cancel the task.

trans-unit.source: TranscodeFileAsync
trans-unit.target: TranscodeFileAsync

trans-unit.source: In the method you used to create the Progress object in the previous step, **Progress**, set the progress of the background task instance.
trans-unit.target: In the method you used to create the Progress object in the previous step, **Progress**, set the progress of the background task instance.

trans-unit.source: This will pass the progress to the foreground app, if it is running.
trans-unit.target: This will pass the progress to the foreground app, if it is running.

trans-unit.source: Progress
trans-unit.target: Progress

trans-unit.source: The **SendToastNotification** helper method creates a new toast notification by getting a template XML document for a toast that only has text content.
trans-unit.target: The **SendToastNotification** helper method creates a new toast notification by getting a template XML document for a toast that only has text content.

trans-unit.source: The text element of the toast XML is set and then a new [**ToastNotification**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208641) object is created from the XML document.
trans-unit.target: The text element of the toast XML is set and then a new [**ToastNotification**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208641) object is created from the XML document.

trans-unit.source: Finally, the toast is shown to the user by calling [**ToastNotifier.Show**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208659).
trans-unit.target: Finally, the toast is shown to the user by calling [**ToastNotifier.Show**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208659).

trans-unit.source: SendToastNotification
trans-unit.target: SendToastNotification

trans-unit.source: Register and launch the background task
trans-unit.target: Register and launch the background task

trans-unit.source: Before you can launch the background task from your foreground app, you must update your foreground app's Package.appmanifest file to let the system know that your app uses a background task.
trans-unit.target: Before you can launch the background task from your foreground app, you must update your foreground app's Package.appmanifest file to let the system know that your app uses a background task.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, double-click the Package.appmanifest file icon to open the manifest editor.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, double-click the Package.appmanifest file icon to open the manifest editor.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Declarations** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Declarations** tab.

trans-unit.source: From **Available Declarations**, select **Background Tasks** and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: From **Available Declarations**, select **Background Tasks** and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Supported Declarations** make sure that the **Background Tasks** item is selected.
trans-unit.target: Under **Supported Declarations** make sure that the **Background Tasks** item is selected.

trans-unit.source: Under **Properties**, select the checkbox for **Media processing**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Properties**, select the checkbox for **Media processing**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Entry Point** text box, specify the namespace and class name for your background test, separated by a period.
trans-unit.target: In the **Entry Point** text box, specify the namespace and class name for your background test, separated by a period.

trans-unit.source: For this example, the entry is:
trans-unit.target: For this example, the entry is:

trans-unit.source: Next, you need to add a reference to your background task to your foreground app.
trans-unit.target: Next, you need to add a reference to your background task to your foreground app.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, under your foreground app project, right-click the **References** folder and select **Add Reference...**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, under your foreground app project, right-click the **References** folder and select **Add Reference...**.

trans-unit.source: Expand the **Projects** node and select **Solution**.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **Projects** node and select **Solution**.

trans-unit.source: Check the box next to your background task project and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Check the box next to your background task project and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: The rest of the code in this example should be added to your foreground app.
trans-unit.target: The rest of the code in this example should be added to your foreground app.

trans-unit.source: First, you will need to add the following namespaces to your project.
trans-unit.target: First, you will need to add the following namespaces to your project.

trans-unit.source: ForegroundUsing
trans-unit.target: ForegroundUsing

trans-unit.source: Next, add the following member variables that are needed to register the background task.
trans-unit.target: Next, add the following member variables that are needed to register the background task.

trans-unit.source: ForegroundMembers
trans-unit.target: ForegroundMembers

trans-unit.source: The **PickFilesToTranscode** helper method uses a [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) and a [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) to open the input and output files for transcoding.
trans-unit.target: The **PickFilesToTranscode** helper method uses a [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) and a [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) to open the input and output files for transcoding.

trans-unit.source: The user may select files in a location that your app does not have access to.
trans-unit.target: The user may select files in a location that your app does not have access to.

trans-unit.source: To make sure your background task can open the files, add them to the [**FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) for your app.
trans-unit.target: To make sure your background task can open the files, add them to the [**FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) for your app.

trans-unit.source: Finally, set entries for the input and output file names in the [**LocalSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241622) for your app.
trans-unit.target: Finally, set entries for the input and output file names in the [**LocalSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241622) for your app.

trans-unit.source: The background task retrieves the file names from this location.
trans-unit.target: The background task retrieves the file names from this location.

trans-unit.source: PickFilesToTranscode
trans-unit.target: PickFilesToTranscode

trans-unit.source: To register the background task, create a new [**MediaProcessingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806005) and a new [**BackgroundTaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768).
trans-unit.target: To register the background task, create a new [**MediaProcessingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806005) and a new [**BackgroundTaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768).

trans-unit.source: Set the name of the background task builder so that you can identify it later.
trans-unit.target: Set the name of the background task builder so that you can identify it later.

trans-unit.source: Set the [**TaskEntryPoint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224774) to the same namespace and class name string you used in the manifest file.
trans-unit.target: Set the [**TaskEntryPoint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224774) to the same namespace and class name string you used in the manifest file.

trans-unit.source: Set the [**Trigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn641725) property to the **MediaProcessingTrigger** instance.
trans-unit.target: Set the [**Trigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn641725) property to the **MediaProcessingTrigger** instance.

trans-unit.source: Before registering the task, make sure you unregister any previously registered tasks by looping through the [**AllTasks**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224787) collection and calling [**Unregister**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229870) on any tasks that have the name you specified in the [**BackgroundTaskBuilder.Name**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224771) property.
trans-unit.target: Before registering the task, make sure you unregister any previously registered tasks by looping through the [**AllTasks**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224787) collection and calling [**Unregister**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229870) on any tasks that have the name you specified in the [**BackgroundTaskBuilder.Name**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224771) property.

trans-unit.source: Register the background task by calling [**Register**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224772).
trans-unit.target: Register the background task by calling [**Register**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224772).

trans-unit.source: Register handlers for the [**Completed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224788) and [**Progress**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224808) events.
trans-unit.target: Register handlers for the [**Completed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224788) and [**Progress**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224808) events.

trans-unit.source: RegisterBackgroundTask
trans-unit.target: RegisterBackgroundTask

trans-unit.source: Launch the background task by calling the **MediaProcessingTrigger** object's [**RequestAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn765071) method.
trans-unit.target: Launch the background task by calling the **MediaProcessingTrigger** object's [**RequestAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn765071) method.

trans-unit.source: The [**MediaProcessingTriggerResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806007) object returned by this method lets you know whether the background task was started successfully, and if not, lets you know why the background task wasn't launched.
trans-unit.target: The [**MediaProcessingTriggerResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806007) object returned by this method lets you know whether the background task was started successfully, and if not, lets you know why the background task wasn't launched.

trans-unit.source: LaunchBackgroundTask
trans-unit.target: LaunchBackgroundTask

trans-unit.source: The **OnProgress** event handler is called when the background task updates the progress of the operation.
trans-unit.target: The **OnProgress** event handler is called when the background task updates the progress of the operation.

trans-unit.source: You can use this opportunity to update your UI with progress information.
trans-unit.target: You can use this opportunity to update your UI with progress information.

trans-unit.source: OnProgress
trans-unit.target: OnProgress

trans-unit.source: The **OnCompleted** event handler is called when the background task has finished running.
trans-unit.target: The **OnCompleted** event handler is called when the background task has finished running.

trans-unit.source: This is another opportunity to update your UI to give status information to the user.
trans-unit.target: This is another opportunity to update your UI to give status information to the user.

trans-unit.source: OnCompleted
trans-unit.target: OnCompleted
